overview:
Adam is a graduate of Bowdoin College, worked a stint as a research assistant in computational chemistry, and unwittingly landed on Wall Street. This last is source of much mirth to college friends who knew him as a left-leaning liberal who wore Chaco sandals throughout most of the icy New England winters. After his internship at Morgan Stanley’s Process Driven Trading quant group, Adam became one of six employees tasked to start Enterprise Query Services, Morgan’s award-winning integrated accounting and financial reporting platform. In 2006 Adam moved back to his hometown, soon caught the start-up bug, and hasn’t looked back since.

Adam Greene started SweetSpot in response to the lack of recognition of the familial and social impact of diabetes. SweetSpot grew out of Adam’s concern for his father and family and his desire to lighten the daily burden of dealing with diabetes.
